episodes.title: Oregon’s Strange Culture of Cults
episodes.description:
Oregon has a reputation in popular culture for its long and weird history with cults. Whether it was for the cheap abundant land, mystic moody vibes, or just the lack of competition from organized religion, many groups have come to our state and set up new eyebrow-raising belief systems. Today, we’re revisiting a conversation with Kick Ass Oregon History (https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/kick-ass-oregon-history-orhistory-com/id516935929)  podcast host Doug Kenck-Crispin about the impact of a few of our state’s most notorious cults  — and even one group that exists today.     



This episode first aired on Nov. 11, 2024



Mentioned in today’s episode:


     
       
  •  
     Eden Within Eden: Oregon's Utopian Heritage (https://osupress.oregonstate.edu/book/eden-within-eden)  by James J. Kopp
     
       
  •  Wild Wild Country (https://www.netflix.com/title/80145240) 
     
       
  •  
     The TwinRay Mystery: A Spiritual Group in Ashland Raises Eyebrows and Worries (https://www.opb.org/article/2024/05/07/twinray-ashland-oregon-the-haven-cult/)  [OPB]

episodes.title: Oregon’s Latest Eyebrow-Raising Spirituality Group
episodes.description: Today on City Cast Portland, we’re looking into a new-age spirituality group that’s raising eyebrows in Ashland, and how they fit into Oregon’s strange propensity for attracting religious cults. Plus, we’ll take a look at the worst reviews of some of Portland’s best karaoke spots. Joining executive producer John Notarianni on this midweek news roundup is our very own producer, Giulia Fiaoni. Discussed in Today’s Episode: The TwinRay Mystery: A Spiritual Group in Ashland Raises Eyebrows and Worries [OPB] Inside Ashland's TwinRay Cult [The Guru] ‘Bundyville’ [OPB] Become a member of City Cast Portland today!
